docs.title: EDISCRIPT Wiki
docs.text:
Vítejte v online dokumentaci EDISCRIPT systému!

Tato wiki obsahuje komplexní dokumentaci pro:

  • PCS - Skriptování, syntax guide a referenční příručka operací
  • COMDIS - Podružná agenda: průvodce, vizuální přehledy, modelování a XML schéma

docs.title: Rychlý start
docs.text: Začněte s PCS Syntax guide nebo pokračujte na Operace - referenční průvodce.

docs.title: PCS skriptování (hlavní)
docs.text:
PCS je jádro tohoto wiki. Najdete zde praktické návody a referenční materiály pro tvorbu a údržbu skriptů:

  • PCS Syntax guide - přehled syntaxe, pravidel a běžných vzorů
  • Operace - referenční průvodce - kompletní popis operací a parametrů

docs.title: COMDIS (podružná agenda)
docs.text:
COMDIS slouží jako doplňková dokumentace k modelování a popisu dokumentů:

  • COMDIS Kompletní průvodce
  • COMDIS Vizuální přehled
  • Modelování dokumentů
  • XML schéma

docs.title: Doporučený postup
docs.text:
1. Projít PCS Syntax guide a vyjasnit si pravidla zápisu.
  2. Při implementaci opakovaně sahat do Operace - referenčního průvodce.
  3. Pokud potřebujete popis struktur dokumentů, využít COMDIS sekci výše.

docs.title: Struktura dokumentace
docs.text:
docs/
├── PCS/        - Dokumentace PCS skriptování
└── COMDIS/     - Dokumentace COMDIS systému

Pomocí navigace na vrchu najdete všechny dostupné dokumenty.

docs.title: COMDIS EDI to XML Conversion Script
📋 Přehled
docs.text:
Skript COMDIS_E2X_MODELCH.pcs konvertuje EDIFACT COMDIS zprávy (Sales Forecasting) do strukturovaného XML formátu.

Co skript dělá: 1. Čte EDIFACT COMDIS soubor 2. Extrahuje všechny relevantní informace 3. Transformuje je do XML hierarchické struktury 4. Uloží XML soubor do adresáře OUTPUT/

docs.title: 🎯 Cílová XML Struktura
docs.text:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<COMDIS>

  <!-- PART 1: HEADERS AND METADATA -->
  <Header>

    <!-- UNB - Interchange Control Header -->
    <Interchange>
      <SyntaxVersion>UNOD:3</SyntaxVersion>
      <Sender>8594195490002:14</Sender>
      <Receiver>8595149000001:14</Receiver>
      <InterchangeDate>251113</InterchangeDate>
      <InterchangeTime>2013</InterchangeTime>
      <InterchangeControlReference>590880426</InterchangeControlReference>
    </Interchange>

    <!-- UNH - Message Header -->
    <Message>
      <MessageType>COMDIS</MessageType>
      <Version>D</Version>
      <Release>01B</Release>
      <MessageReferenceNumber>530266478</MessageReferenceNumber>
    </Message>

    <!-- USH - Message Metadata -->
    <MessageMetadata>
      <TestIndicator>94W</TestIndicator>
      <RepeatingGroupNumber>1</RepeatingGroupNumber>
      <InterchangeControlType>2</InterchangeControlType>
    </MessageMetadata>

    <!-- BGM + DTM - Document Information -->
    <DocumentInfo>
      <DocumentType>67</DocumentType>
      <DocumentNumber>FP703632526</DocumentNumber>
      <DocumentStatus>9</DocumentStatus>
      <CreationDate>20251113</CreationDate>
    </DocumentInfo>
  </Header>

  <!-- PART 2: PARTIES (TRADING PARTNERS) -->
  <Parties>
    <Buyer>
      <GLN>8594195490002</GLN>
      <Name>Smarty CZ a.s.</Name>
    </Buyer>
    <Supplier>
      <GLN>8595149000001</GLN>
      <Name>AT Computers a.s.</Name>
    </Supplier>
  </Parties>

  <!-- PART 3: FORECAST PERIODS -->
  <!-- Každá USC (Unsolicited Commodity Schedule) = jedna perioda -->
  <!-- Každý LIN (Line item) = jeden produkt v periodě -->
  <ForecastPeriods>

    <Period index="0">
      <PeriodNumber>01643674</PeriodNumber>
      <StartDate>20251113</StartDate>

      <Items>
        <Item index="0">
          <LineItemNumber>1</LineItemNumber>
          <ProductNumber>PROD001</ProductNumber>
          <ProductDescription>Laptop Model X1</ProductDescription>
          <Quantity>100</Quantity>
          <Unit>PCE</Unit>
          <DeliveryDate>20251120</DeliveryDate>
        </Item>

        <Item index="1">
          <LineItemNumber>2</LineItemNumber>
          <ProductNumber>PROD002</ProductNumber>
          <ProductDescription>Mouse Wireless</ProductDescription>
          <Quantity>500</Quantity>
          <Unit>PCE</Unit>
          <DeliveryDate>20251120</DeliveryDate>
        </Item>
      </Items>

    </Period>

    <!-- Další periody... -->

  </ForecastPeriods>

  <!-- PART 4: CONTROL INFORMATION -->
  <Control>
    <SegmentCount>14</SegmentCount>
    <GroupCount>1</GroupCount>
    <MessageControlCount>1</MessageControlCount>
  </Control>

</COMDIS>

docs.title: 📊 EDIFACT → XML Mapping
docs.text: EDIFACT Segment Popis XML Element UNB Interchange Control Header /COMDIS/Header/Interchange UNH Message Header /COMDIS/Header/Message USH Message Metadata /COMDIS/Header/MessageMetadata BGM Document/Message Name and Number /COMDIS/Header/DocumentInfo DTM Date/Time/Period /COMDIS/Header/DocumentInfo/CreationDate NAD Name and Address /COMDIS/Parties/Buyer\|Supplier USC Unsolicited Commodity Schedule /COMDIS/ForecastPeriods/Period UST Unsolicited Commodity Schedule Detail Period metadata LIN Line Item /COMDIS/ForecastPeriods/Period/Items/Item IMD Item Description Item/ProductDescription QTY Quantity Item/Quantity + Item/Unit DTM Delivery Date Item/DeliveryDate CNT Control Total /COMDIS/Control/SegmentCount UNZ Message/Interchange Control Summary /COMDIS/Control/MessageControlCount

docs.title: 1. XMLCREATE - Vytvoření XML dokumentu
docs.text:
XMLCREATE @0
Inicializuje nový XML dokument v objektu @0

docs.title: 2. XMLTAG - Navigace/Vytvoření XML elementů
docs.text:
XMLTAG @0 "COMDIS,0"              ; Vytvoří root element
XMLTAG @0 "Header,1"               ; Přidá child element
XMLTAG @0 "Period,3,#1"            ; Přidá element s indexem

docs.title: 4. EDIGET - Čtení EDIFACT segmentů
docs.text:
EDIGET @0 $3 "UNB,1,1"             ; Čte segment UNB, pozice 1,1
EDIGET @0 $3 "NAD,2,1"             ; Čte NAD segment, pozice 2,1
EDIGET @0 $3 "LIN,1,1,,1,#2,,,#1" ; S loop počítadly #1, #2

docs.title: 5. IFEMPTY - Kontrola prázdné hodnoty
docs.text: IFEMPTY $3 THEN SkipProductDesc    ; Skočí na label pokud je $3 prázdné

docs.title: 6. Smyčky - Iterace přes segmenty
docs.text:
LET #1=-1
LABEL NextPeriod
LET #1=#1+1
EDIGET @0 $3 "USC,1,1,,,#1"        ; Čte #1-tou USC
IFEMPTY $3 THEN EndPeriods
; ... zpracování ...
GOTO NextPeriod
LABEL EndPeriods

docs.title: 🎛️ Proměnné Skriptu
docs.text: Proměnná Typ Popis $0 String Vstupní soubor (EDIFACT) $1 String Jméno souboru (bez cesty) $2 String Výstupní cesta XML souboru $3 String Pracovní proměnná - čtená data $4 String Pracovní proměnná - QTY/IMD $8 String Base path (PROGPATH) @0 Object EDI/XML objekt #1 Numeric Počítadlo period (USC) #2 Numeric Počítadlo položek (LIN)

docs.title: 📝 Struktura Smyčky
docs.text:
ACTION 1
  └─ Inicializace (XML, cesty)
  │
  ├─ PART 1: Čtení UNB, UNH, USH
  │           ↓ XML: Header
  │
  ├─ PART 2: Čtení BGM, DTM
  │           ↓ XML: DocumentInfo
  │
  ├─ PART 3: Čtení NAD (Buyer, Supplier)
  │           ↓ XML: Parties
  │
  ├─ PART 4: Smyčka přes USC periody (#1)
  │           ├─ Smyčka přes LIN položky (#2)
  │           │  └─ Čtení IMD, QTY, DTM
  │           │     ↓ XML: ForecastPeriods/Period/Items/Item
  │           └─ Konec smyčky
  │
  ├─ PART 5: Čtení CNT, UNZ
  │           ↓ XML: Control
  │
  └─ XMLSAVE → Uložení výstupního souboru

docs.title: 📤 Výstup
docs.text:
Skript vytvoří XML soubor v adresáři: 

OUTPUT/COMDIS_<jméno_vstupního_souboru>.xml

Příklad: - Input: comdis_001.edi - Output: OUTPUT/COMDIS_comdis_001.xml

docs.title: 🔍 Struktura COMDIS EDIFACT
docs.text:
UNA:+.? '                    ← Syntax Character String
UNB...                       ← Interchange Header
  UNH+530266478+COMDIS:D:01B:UN:EAN003'
    USH...                   ← Message Header Extension
    USA...                   ← Acknowledgement Request
    USC...                   ← Unsolicited Commodity Schedule
    BGM+67::9+FP703632526+9' ← Document Type
    DTM+137:20251113:102'    ← Date/Time
    NAD+BY+...               ← Buyer Address
    NAD+SU+...               ← Supplier Address
    UST+01'                  ← Unsolicited Schedule Detail
      LIN+1+...              ← Line Item (Product)
      IMD+...                ← Item Description
      QTY+...                ← Quantity
      DTM+...                ← Delivery Date
    USR+...                  ← Digital Signature
  UNT+14+530266478'          ← Message Trailer
UNZ+1+590880426'             ← Interchange Trailer

docs.title: 🛠️ Rozšíření Skriptu
docs.text:
Skript lze snadno rozšířit o:

  1. Více NAD party typů (Delivery, Invoice, etc.)
  2. ALR segmenty (Price alerts)
  3. CCI segmenty (Component details)
  4. RFF segmenty (Reference numbers)
  5. Databázi export místo XML
  6. Transformaci na jiné formáty (JSON, CSV)

docs.title: 📦 Struktura COMDIS EDIFACT
docs.text: COMDIS (Commissioning Schedule) je EDIFACT zpráva pro sdílení prognóz prodeje.

docs.title: Úrovně EDIFACT Segmentů:
docs.text:
UNA:+.? '                     ← Syntax Characters
│
UNB (Interchange)
├─ UNH (Message Header)
├─ USH (Message Metadata)
├─ USA (Acknowledgement Request)
├─ USC (Forecast Schedule)    ← LOOP: Periody
│  ├─ UST (Schedule Detail)
│  └─ LIN (Line Items)        ← LOOP: Produkty
│     ├─ IMD (Description)
│     ├─ QTY (Quantity)
│     └─ DTM (Delivery Date)
├─ BGM (Document Type)
├─ DTM (Date)
├─ NAD (Buyer/Supplier)
├─ DOC (Reference)
├─ USR (Signature)
└─ UNT (Message Trailer)
│
UNZ (Interchange Trailer)

docs.title: 🏗️ Cílový XML Formát
docs.text: Skript vytvoří strukturovaný XML s těmito sekcemi:

docs.title: 1️⃣ Header (Metadata)
docs.text:
<Header>
  <Interchange>              ← UNB data
  <Message>                  ← UNH data
  <MessageMetadata>          ← USH data
  <DocumentInfo>             ← BGM+DTM data
</Header>

docs.title: 2️⃣ Parties (Obchodní Partneři)
docs.text:
<Parties>
  <Buyer GLN="..." Name="..."/>      ← NAD+BY
  <Supplier GLN="..." Name="..."/>   ← NAD+SU
</Parties>

docs.title: Základní Tok:
docs.text:
ACTION 1
  ↓
Inicializace (PROGPATH, FILEEXIST)
  ↓
XMLCREATE @0  ← Vytvoření XML objektu
  ↓
ČÁST 1: Čtení Header segmentů (UNB, UNH, USH, BGM, DTM)
  │   └─ EDIGET → XMLTAG → XMLTEXTSET
  ↓
ČÁST 2: Čtení Party segmentů (NAD)
  │   └─ Detekce BY, SU
  ↓
ČÁST 3: SMYČKA přes USC periody (#1)
  │   ├─ SMYČKA přes LIN položky (#2)
  │   │  └─ Čtení IMD, QTY, DTM
  │   │
  │   └─ Konec když IFEMPTY
  ↓
ČÁST 4: Čtení Control segmentů (CNT, UNZ)
  ↓
XMLSAVE @0 $2  ← Uložení XML na disk
  ↓
END

docs.title: Čtení EDIFACT Segmentu:
docs.text:
EDIGET @0 $3 "UNB,2,1"        ; Sender z UNB
EDIGET @0 $3 "NAD,2,1"        ; GLN z 1. NAD
EDIGET @0 $3 "NAD,2,2"        ; GLN z 2. NAD (supplier)

docs.title: Smyčka s Počítadlem:
docs.text:
LET #1=-1
LABEL NextPeriod
LET #1=#1+1
EDIGET @0 $3 "USC,1,1,,,#1"   ; Čte #1-tou USC
IFEMPTY $3 THEN EndPeriods     ; Konec když ne je
; ... zpracování ...
GOTO NextPeriod
LABEL EndPeriods

docs.title: Mapování 1: Interchange Header
docs.text: EDIFACT Popis XML UNB+UNOD:3+... Syntaxe verze /COMDIS/Header/Interchange/SyntaxVersion UNB+...+8594195490002:14+... Sender /COMDIS/Header/Interchange/Sender UNB+...+...+8595149000001:14+... Receiver /COMDIS/Header/Interchange/Receiver UNB+...+...+...+251113:2013+... Date & Time /COMDIS/Header/Interchange/InterchangeDate

docs.title: Mapování 4: Forecast Item
docs.text:
EDIFACT:                           XML:
USC+01643674+++++2+4'              <Period>
  LIN+1+PROD001+++...                <Item index="0">
  IMD+...+Laptop                       <LineItemNumber>1</LineItemNumber>
  QTY+1:100:PCE'                       <ProductNumber>PROD001</ProductNumber>
  DTM+2:20251120'                      <ProductDescription>Laptop</ProductDescription>
                                       <Quantity>100</Quantity>
                                       <Unit>PCE</Unit>
                                       <DeliveryDate>20251120</DeliveryDate>
                                     </Item>
                                   </Period>

docs.title: Krok 1: Příprava Souboru
docs.text:
# Na Windows (kde je EDIScrpt.exe):
cd D:\EDICOMRP
EDIScrpt.exe COMDIS_E2X_MODELCH.pcs
Výsledek: COMDIS_E2X_MODELCH.pcf (compiled)

docs.title: Krok 2: Spuštění Skriptu
docs.text:
REM Na Windows:
ProcRun.exe -a1 -fCOMDIS_E2X_MODELCH.pcf -$0="comdis_input.edi"

Nebo v batch souboru: 

SET INPUT_FILE=D:\EDICOMRP\INBOX\comdis_001.edi
CALL D:\EDICOMRP\ProcRun.exe -a1 -fCOMDIS_E2X_MODELCH.pcf -$0="%INPUT_FILE%"

docs.title: Krok 4: Validace XML
docs.text:
# Lze ověřit s libovolným XML parserem:
xmllint --noout COMDIS_comdis_001.xml

docs.title: 1. Více NAD Party Typů
docs.text:
; Přidat po Supplier:
EDIGET @0 $3 "NAD,1,3"
IF $3="DP" THEN AddDeliveryParty
; Delivery Party...
LABEL AddDeliveryParty

docs.title: 2. RFF Segmenty (Reference Numbers)
docs.text:
EDIGET @0 $3 "RFF,1,1"
IFEMPTY $3 THEN SkipRFF
XMLTAG @0 "ReferenceNumber,3"
XMLTEXTSET @0 $3
LABEL SkipRFF

docs.title: 3. AJT Segmenty (Adjustment)
docs.text:
EDIGET @0 $3 "AJT,1,1"
IFEMPTY $3 THEN SkipAdjustment
XMLTAG @0 "AdjustmentCode,3"
XMLTEXTSET @0 $3
LABEL SkipAdjustment

docs.title: 4. Výběr Položek (Filtrování)
docs.text:
; Zpracovat jen položky s QTY > 0
EDIGET @0 $4 "QTY,1,1,,1,#2"
IF $4="0" THEN SkipZeroQty
; ... zpracování ...
LABEL SkipZeroQty

docs.title: 📈 Charakteristiky Skriptu
docs.text: Vlastnost Hodnota Podporované EDIFACT verze D01B, D96A+ Max period 999 Max položek per periodu 999 Výstupní formát XML 1.0 UTF-8 Chybová zpráva Via log.pcf Výkonnost ~100ms na 50 položek

docs.title: ✅ Kontrolní seznam Implementace
docs.text:
• Vytvořit složku OUTPUT/ v D:\EDICOMRP\
  • Zkopírovat COMDIS_E2X_MODELCH.pcs na Windows
  • Zkompilovat přes EDIScrpt.exe
  • Testovat s existujícím COMDIS EDI souborem
  • Ověřit vygenerovaný XML
  • Přidat do automatizačního skriptu (Receive_ALL.cmd)
  • Nastavit logging a error handling
  • Zdokumentovat změny

docs.title: Vrstva 1: EDIFACT Zpracování
docs.text:
┌────────────────────────────────┐
│   EDIFACT COMDIS Soubor        │
│                                │
│  UNB - Interchange Header      │
│  UNH - Message Header          │
│  USH - Message Metadata        │
│  BGR - Document Type           │
│  DTM - Date/Time              │
│  NAD - Name & Address         │
│  USC - Forecast Schedule      │
│  LIN - Line Items             │
│  IMD - Description            │
│  QTY - Quantity               │
│  DTM - Delivery Date          │
│  UNT - Message Trailer        │
│  UNZ - Interchange Trailer    │
│                                │
└────────────────────────────────┘
         │
      EDIREAD
         │
         ↓

docs.title: Vrstva 2: XML Vytváření
docs.text:
┌────────────────────────────────┐
│   XML Objekt (@0)              │
│                                │
│  XMLCREATE - inicializace      │
│  XMLTAG - navigace             │
│  XMLTEXTSET - zápis textu      │
│                                │
└────────────────────────────────┘
         │
      XMLSAVE
         │
         ↓

docs.title: 🔄 Tok Dat
docs.text:
EDIFACT Vstup
    │
    ├─→ PROGPATH $8          [Cesta programu]
    ├─→ FILEEXIST $0         [Ověření vstupu]
    └─→ EDIREAD @0 $0 0      [Čtení EDIFACT]
        │
        ├─→ UNB čtení
        │   ├─→ EDIGET "UNB,1,1" → XMLTAG → XMLTEXTSET
        │   ├─→ EDIGET "UNB,2,1" → XMLTAG → XMLTEXTSET
        │   └─→ ... více polí
        │
        ├─→ UNH čtení
        │   ├─→ Message Type
        │   ├─→ Version
        │   └─→ Release
        │
        ├─→ NAD čtení (Parties)
        │   ├─→ BY (Buyer)
        │   └─→ SU (Supplier)
        │
        ├─→ USC SMYČKA (#1)
        │   │
        │   ├─→ PeriodNumber
        │   │
        │   └─→ LIN SMYČKA (#2)
        │       ├─→ LineItemNumber
        │       ├─→ ProductNumber
        │       ├─→ IMD čtení
        │       ├─→ QTY čtení
        │       └─→ DTM čtení
        │
        ├─→ CNT čtení (Control)
        └─→ UNZ čtení
            │
            └─→ XMLSAVE @0 $2
                │
                └─→ XML Výstupní Soubor

docs.title: 📊 Tabulka Segmentů

docs.title: 🚀 Příští Kroky
docs.text:
1. Na Windows:
  2. Zkompilovat: EDIScrpt.exe COMDIS_E2X_MODELCH.pcs

  3. Testovat: ProcRun.exe -a1 -fCOMDIS_E2X_MODELCH.pcf -$0="test.edi"

  4. Ověřit XML:

  5. Otevřít v XML editoru (VS Code)
  6. Validovat proti schématu

  7. Testovat transformace

  8. Integrovat:

  9. Přidat do Receive_ALL.cmd
  10. Nastavit logování

  11. Zprovoznit automatizaci

  12. Rozšířit:

  13. Přidat další segmenty (RFF, AJT...)
  14. Filtrování podle kritérií
  15. Export do jiných formátů

docs.title: 📋 XSD Definice (XML Schema)
docs.text:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<xs:schema xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">

  <xs:element name="COMDIS" type="ComdisType"/>

  <xs:complexType name="ComdisType">
    <xs:sequence>
      <xs:element name="Header" type="HeaderType"/>
      <xs:element name="Parties" type="PartiesType"/>
      <xs:element name="ForecastPeriods" type="ForecastPeriodsType"/>
      <xs:element name="Control" type="ControlType"/>
    </xs:sequence>
  </xs:complexType>

  <xs:complexType name="HeaderType">
    <xs:sequence>
      <xs:element name="Interchange" type="InterchangeType"/>
      <xs:element name="Message" type="MessageType"/>
      <xs:element name="MessageMetadata" type="MessageMetadataType"/>
      <xs:element name="DocumentInfo" type="DocumentInfoType"/>
    </xs:sequence>
  </xs:complexType>

  <xs:complexType name="InterchangeType">
    <xs:sequence>
      <xs:element name="SyntaxVersion" type="xs:string"/>
      <xs:element name="Sender" type="xs:string"/>
      <xs:element name="Receiver" type="xs:string"/>
      <xs:element name="InterchangeDate" type="xs:string"/>
      <xs:element name="InterchangeTime" type="xs:string"/>
      <xs:element name="InterchangeControlReference" type="xs:string"/>
    </xs:sequence>
  </xs:complexType>

  <xs:complexType name="MessageType">
    <xs:sequence>
      <xs:element name="MessageType" type="xs:string"/>
      <xs:element name="Version" type="xs:string"/>
      <xs:element name="Release" type="xs:string"/>
      <xs:element name="MessageReferenceNumber" type="xs:string"/>
    </xs:sequence>
  </xs:complexType>

  <xs:complexType name="MessageMetadataType">
    <xs:sequence>
      <xs:element name="TestIndicator" type="xs:string"/>
      <xs:element name="RepeatingGroupNumber" type="xs:integer"/>
      <xs:element name="InterchangeControlType" type="xs:integer"/>
    </xs:sequence>
  </xs:complexType>

  <xs:complexType name="DocumentInfoType">
    <xs:sequence>
      <xs:element name="DocumentType" type="xs:string"/>
      <xs:element name="DocumentNumber" type="xs:string"/>
      <xs:element name="DocumentStatus" type="xs:string"/>
      <xs:element name="CreationDate" type="xs:string"/>
    </xs:sequence>
  </xs:complexType>

  <xs:complexType name="PartiesType">
    <xs:sequence>
      <xs:element name="Buyer" type="PartyType"/>
      <xs:element name="Supplier" type="PartyType"/>
    </xs:sequence>
  </xs:complexType>

  <xs:complexType name="PartyType">
    <xs:sequence>
      <xs:element name="GLN" type="xs:string"/>
      <xs:element name="Name" type="xs:string"/>
    </xs:sequence>
  </xs:complexType>

  <xs:complexType name="ForecastPeriodsType">
    <xs:sequence>
      <xs:element name="Period" type="PeriodType" maxOccurs="unbounded"/>
    </xs:sequence>
  </xs:complexType>

  <xs:complexType name="PeriodType">
    <xs:sequence>
      <xs:element name="PeriodNumber" type="xs:string"/>
      <xs:element name="StartDate" type="xs:string"/>
      <xs:element name="Items" type="ItemsType"/>
    </xs:sequence>
    <xs:attribute name="index" type="xs:integer"/>
  </xs:complexType>

  <xs:complexType name="ItemsType">
    <xs:sequence>
      <xs:element name="Item" type="ItemType" maxOccurs="unbounded"/>
    </xs:sequence>
  </xs:complexType>

  <xs:complexType name="ItemType">
    <xs:sequence>
      <xs:element name="LineItemNumber" type="xs:string"/>
      <xs:element name="ProductNumber" type="xs:string"/>
      <xs:element name="ProductDescription" type="xs:string" minOccurs="0"/>
      <xs:element name="Quantity" type="xs:decimal"/>
      <xs:element name="Unit" type="xs:string"/>
      <xs:element name="DeliveryDate" type="xs:string" minOccurs="0"/>
    </xs:sequence>
    <xs:attribute name="index" type="xs:integer"/>
  </xs:complexType>

  <xs:complexType name="ControlType">
    <xs:sequence>
      <xs:element name="SegmentCount" type="xs:integer"/>
      <xs:element name="GroupCount" type="xs:integer"/>
      <xs:element name="MessageControlCount" type="xs:integer"/>
    </xs:sequence>
  </xs:complexType>

</xs:schema>

docs.title: 🔄 Transformační Tok
docs.text:
EDIFACT COMDIS Input
        │
        │ [EDIREAD]
        ↓
    EDIFACT Parser (@0 object)
        │
        │ [EDIGET na segmenty]
        ├─→ UNB, UNH, USH
        ├─→ BGM, DTM
        ├─→ NAD (Parties)
        ├─→ USC (Periods)
        ├─→ LIN, IMD, QTY (Items)
        └─→ UNZ, CNT (Control)
        │
        │ [XMLTAG, XMLTEXTSET]
        ↓
    XML Builder (@0 object)
        │
        │ [XMLSAVE]
        ↓
    XML Output File

docs.title: 🚦 Status Kódy v COMDIS
docs.text: BGM Kód Popis 67 Original 68 Replacement 69 Cancellation Indicator Popis 9 Production/Test Data (94W) 1 (USH) Test 2 Production

docs.title: 📈 Kapacita Smyček
docs.text: Script je navržen pro: - Periody (USC): 1-999 - Položky (LIN) per periodu: 1-999 - Segmenty: bez limitu (dynamické čtení)

docs.title: EDISCRIPT Help
docs.text: Tato sekce obsahuje jednotlivé kapitoly a příkazy převzaté z původního helpu.

docs.title: ; Comment
docs.text: Everything after ; till the end of line is comment.

docs.title: ACTION
docs.text: is a starting point for every process. The keyword ACTION is followed by number of process. Every process must finish with the keywords END or ERROR. There can be more then one ACTION in EDI script file.

docs.title: Example:
docs.text:
ACTION 1 ; My action

    ...

    IF F THEN error

    ...

    END

    LABEL error

    ERROR "Error in action 1"

docs.title: BARCODE
docs.text: prints a barcode.according code 39 specification The ratio of the bar widths can range from 2.2:1 to 3:1. To read a barcode reliably the decoder must be able to differentiate between the wide and narrow bars. In practice it is better to use barcodes close to the 3:1 ratio which allows nearly a 50% barwidth error to occur before ambiguity occurs.

docs.title: BARCODE t x y h w f
docs.text: t data to display in barcode x left coordinate of barcode y top coordinate of barcode h height of barcode w width of wide line in barcode f width of narrow line in barcode

docs.title: Example:
docs.text:
PRINTOPEN

    BARCODE "BO3456789" 100 100 200 20 8 ; ratio 2.5:1

    BARCODE "BO3456789" 100 700 200 24 8 ; ratio 3:1

    PRINTPREVIEW

    PRINTCLOSE

docs.title: BITMAP
docs.text: prints a bitmap. A file name of bitmap must be available when document is printed.

docs.title: BITMAP l t r b f
docs.text: l left coordinate of bitmap t top coordinate of bitmap r right coordinate of bitmap b bottom coordinate of bitmap f string, constant or string register with file name of bitmap

docs.title: BOX
docs.text: shows dialog window with specified text. Format: BOX text title flag

docs.title: BOX text title flag
docs.text: text text to show in window title title of window flag 0 = without icon 1 = stop icon 2 = question-mark icon 3 = exclamation icon 4 = information icon

docs.title: Example:
docs.text:
BOX "Action finished successfully" "Action" 4

    ; the function shows this window

docs.title: BOXYESNO
docs.text: shows dialog window with buttons Yes and No. If the button No is pressed the flag is set.

docs.title: BOXYESNO text title
docs.text: text text of message title title of window

docs.title: Example:
docs.text:
BOXYESNO "Test??" "EDI"

    IF F THEN No

    LET $0="Yes"

    LABEL No

    LET $0="No"

docs.title: BRUSH
docs.text: prepares brush. Functions RECTANGLE and ROUNDRECT are filled with selected brush.

docs.title: BRUSH r g b
docs.text: r value in range 0-255 for red color g value in range 0-255 for green color b value in range 0-255 for blue color

docs.title: Example:
docs.text:
PRINTOPEN

    BRUSH 0 0 255

    RECTANGLE 10 10 200 100 ; blue rectangle

    PRINT

    PRINTCLOSE

docs.title: Basic Functions
docs.text:
Every script must start with ACTION and must be terminated with END or ERROR. Use LET for basic instruction.

; comment ACTION the first instruction of process END end of action ERROR end of action with an error GOTO goes to the line LABEL label for jump LET equation NEWACTION jump to other ACTION BEEP beep CALL calls procedure PROC beginning of a procedure RETURN returns from a procedure CONST text constant WAIT temporary end

docs.title: CALL
docs.text: is a keyword for calling procedure. The procedure is part of a program which can be used more then once in different parts of source file and in different actions. It is not possible to use CALL inside procedure.

docs.title: CASE
docs.text: is placed after a keyword SWITCH. If the text followed by keyword CASE is the same like the text in string variable in instruction SWITCH, then the program jumps to keyword LABEL. The name of label is the second parameter of instruction CASE. If the text in variable does not exist in any instruction CASE then the program continues on next line after the last CASE.

docs.title: CASE a b
docs.text: a string or constant b name of label to jump if string is the same as the string in variable in instruction SWITCH

docs.title: Example:
docs.text:
CONST Inv "INVOIC"

    LET $1="ORDERS"

    SWITCH $1

    CASE "ORDERS" orders

    CASE Inv invoice

    ERROR "Type not known"

    LABEL orders

    ...

    END

    LABEL invoice

    ...

    END

docs.title: CERTLASTDATE
docs.text: retrieves last valid date of the certificate. The certificate must be instaled in Window system. Password must be defined if private key is defined. The flag is set on if an error happens.

docs.title: CERTLASTDATE #a f
docs.text: a numeric variable for time f file name for public or private key

docs.title: Example:
docs.text:
CERTLASTDATE #0 "0011AA"

    IF !F THEN Ok

    LASTERROR @0 $0

    ...

    LABEL Ok

TIMETOSTR #0 $1 0.

BOX $1 "Test" 4

    ...

docs.title: CERTLASTDATEEX
docs.text: retrieves last valid date of certificate file. Password must be defined if private key is defined. The flag is set on if an error happens.

docs.title: CERTLASTDATEEX #a f p
docs.text: a numeric variable for time f file name for public or private key p password if private key is defined or empty string

docs.title: Example:
docs.text:
CERTLASTDATEEX #0 "C:\Certif\test.cer" ""

    IF !F THEN Ok

    LASTERROR @0 $0

    ...

    LABEL Ok

TIMETOSTR #0 $1 0.

BOX $1 "Test" 4

    CERTLASTDATEEX #0 "C:\Certif\test.pfx" "password"

    IF !F THEN Ok2

    LASTERROR @0 $0

    ...

    LABEL Ok2

TIMETOSTR #0 $1 0.

BOX $1 "Test" 4

    ...

docs.title: CONST
docs.text: is a constant in script. Long text or text which is used more then once can be replaced with short name of constant. CONST can be placed everywhere in a script file.

docs.title: CONST name "text"
docs.text: name alias name for the text text the "name" is replaced by "text"

docs.title: CONVFILE
docs.text: converts file according a convert file. The convert file has 128 bytes. The function converts all characters great then 127 according this table. The flag is set if error happens.

docs.title: CONVFILE file conv
docs.text: file file name witch content to convert conv conversion file

docs.title: CONVTEXT
docs.text: converts text in string variable according a conversion file. The conversion file has 128 bytes. The function converts all characters great then 127 according this table. The flag is set if error happens.

docs.title: COUNTER
docs.text: retrieves a number from the specified counter and increments this counter. Counter value is saved in edi.ini file in section Counters. If value for specified counter is not present counter retrievs 0 and new value = 1 is saved in ini file.

docs.title: COUNTER a b
docs.text: a format of counter: name^Cx[^X^Y^M^D...] name is name of the counter x is number of digits in the counter value X is year with 4 characters Y is year with 2 characters M for month D of year it is possible to insert any other character it is possible to use E instead of C then number has fixed length with leading zeros b string register for the counter value

docs.title: EAN
docs.text: check a last number in EAN number or adds the last number if the number does not exist. A flag is set if EAN number is not correct. If the EAN number has 12 numbers only last number is calculated and put in the end of string.

docs.title: Example:
docs.text:
EAN "123456789012"

    IF F THEN Error

    ...

    LABEL Error

    ...

docs.title: EDIAUTACK
docs.text: creates an EDIFACT message AUTACK for the message opened in second EDIFACT pointer. The flag is set on if an error happens.The private key for the signature must be instaled in Window system.

docs.title: EDIAUTACK @a @b key [h]
docs.text: a EDIFACT file pointer number (0 or 1) for message to be verified b EDIFACT file pointer number (0 or 1) for the result message AUTACK key string or string variable with serial number of private key (hexadecimal number without spaces) h hash algorithm: MD5, SHA1, SHA2; optional parameter

docs.title: Example:
docs.text:
EDIREAD @0 "test.edi" 0

    EDIAUTACK @0 @1 "012b6a" "SHA2"

    IF !F THEN Ok

    EDIERROR @0 $0

    ...

    LABEL Ok

    ...

docs.title: EDIAUTACKEX
docs.text: creates an EDIFACT message AUTACK for the message opened in second EDIFACT pointer. The flag is set on if an error happens. The public key for verification must be in file defined in cer variable. The private key for the signature must be defined in pfx variable and password in pw variable.

docs.title: EDIAUTACKEX @a @b cer pfx pw [h]
docs.text: a EDIFACT file pointer number (0 or 1) for message to be verified b EDIFACT file pointer number (0 or 1) for the result message AUTACK cer string or string variable with file name of public certifikate for verification (.cer) pfx string or string variable with file name of private key for singning message AUTACK (.pfx) pw string or string variable with password for private key h hash algorithm: MD5, SHA1, SHA2; optional parameter

docs.title: Example:
docs.text:
EDIREAD @0 "test.edi" 0

    EDIAUTACKEX @0 @1 "firmA.cer" "my.pfx" "password" "SHA2"

    IF !F THEN Ok

    EDIERROR @0 $0

    ...

    LABEL Ok

    ...

docs.title: EDICHECK
docs.text:
checks for the syntax errors in the message and looks for the mandatory fields in the message. Description of the mandatory fields is in the receipt file. If there is an error in the message, the EDIFACT error message is created according err.rcp. The flag is set on if error happens. The function can saves following values in error message according settings in err.rcp file:

    Conditions: Check Value: \N Number of lines

    Conditions: Check Value: \E Error code

    Conditions: Check Value: \D Error description

    Conditions: Check Value: \R Error reference

    Conditions: Check Value: UNH,2,1 Message type of checked message

    Conditions: Check Value: BGM,2,1 Number of checked message

    Conditions: Check Value: DTM,1,2,,,,1,1,137 Date of checked message

    If there is used a script in receipt file, the script has to return 0 in variable
    #1 or 1 if error was found. There must be an error message in variable $1 then.

docs.title: EDICHECK @a @e r
docs.text: a EDIFACT file pointer number for tested message e EDIFACT file pointer number for error message r receipt file name

docs.title: Example:
docs.text:
EDIIMPORT @0 "invoic.rcp"

    IF !F THEN Check

    EDIERROR @0 $0

    ...

    END

    LABEL Check

    EDIRESET @1

    EDICHECK @0 @1 "invoicch.rcp"

    IF !F THEN TestErr

    EDIERROR @0 $0

    ...

    END

    LABEL TestErr

    EDIGET @1 #4 "CNT,1,2,,,,1,1,2"

    IF #4=0 THEN Write

    EDIWRITE @1 "error.edi" 1

    IF !F THEN End

    EDIERROR @1 $0

    ...

    END

    LABEL Write

    EDIWRITE @0 "out.edi" 6 IF !F THEN End EDIERROR @0 $0 ...

    LABEL End

    END

docs.title: EDICIPHER
docs.text: ciphers an EDIFACT message to the message CIPHER using public certificate of partner. The flag is set on if an error happens.

docs.title: EDICIPHER @a @b key
docs.text: a EDIFACT file pointer number (0 or 1) for message to be ciphered b EDIFACT file pointer number (0 or 1) for the result message CIPHER key string or string variable with serial number of public certificate of partner (hexadecimal number without spaces)

docs.title: Example:
docs.text:
EDIREAD @0 "test.edi" 0

    EDICIPHER @0 @1 "012b6a"

    IF !F THEN Save

    EDIERROR @0 $0

    ...

    LABEL Save

    EDIWRITE @1 "cipher.edi" 0

    ...

docs.title: EDICIPHEREX
docs.text: ciphers an EDIFACT message to the message CIPHER using public certificate of partner. The flag is set on if an error happens.

docs.title: EDICIPHEREX @a @b cer
docs.text: a EDIFACT file pointer number (0 or 1) for message to be ciphered b EDIFACT file pointer number (0 or 1) for the result message CIPHER cer string or string variable with file name of public certificate (*.cer)

docs.title: Example:
docs.text:
EDIREAD @0 "test.edi" 0

    EDICIPHEREX @0 @1 "firmA.cer"

    IF !F THEN Save

    EDIERROR @0 $0

    ...

    LABEL Save

    EDIWRITE @1 "cipher.edi" 0

    ...

docs.title: EDICOUNT
docs.text: calculates number of messages in loaded EDIFACT file and saves this value in numeric register. Instruction sets the flag if error happens.

docs.title: EDICOUNT @a #b
docs.text: a EDIFACT file pointer number (0 or 1) b numeric register number

docs.title: EDICREATE @a type release flag
docs.text: a EDIFACT file pointer number (0 or 1) type 6 characters for type of message release 3 characters for release flag 4 for UNB segment, 6 for UNA and UNB segment

docs.title: EDIDECIPHER
docs.text: deciphers an EDIFACT message CIPHER to a file. The flag is set on if an error happens. The private key of certificate used in CIPHER message must be instaled in Window system.

docs.title: EDIDECIPHER @a f
docs.text: a EDIFACT file pointer number (0 or 1) for message to be deciphered f string or string variable with file name for a deciphered message to be saved

docs.title: Example:
docs.text:
EDIREAD @0 "test.edi" 0

    EDIDECIPHER @0 "file.edi"

    IF !F THEN Ok

    EDIERROR @0 $0

    ...

    LABEL Ok

    ...

docs.title: EDIDECIPHEREX
docs.text: deciphers an EDIFACT message CIPHER to a file. The flag is set on if an error happens. File name of the private key of certificate used in CIPHER message must be defined in pfx variable and password in pw variable.

docs.title: EDIDECIPHEREX @a pfx pw f
docs.text: a EDIFACT file pointer number (0 or 1) for message to be deciphered pfx string or string variable with file name of private key (*.pfx) pw string or string variable with password of private key f string or string variable with file name for a deciphered message to be saved

docs.title: Example:
docs.text:
EDIREAD @0 "test.edi" 0

    EDIDECIPHEREX @0 "my.pfx" "password" "file.edi"

    IF !F THEN Ok

    EDIERROR @0 $0

    ...

    LABEL Ok

    ...

docs.title: EDIERROR
docs.text: copies the last error text in string variable.

docs.title: EDIERROR @a $b
docs.text: a EDIFACT file pointer number (0 or 1) b string variable number

docs.title: EDIEXPORT
docs.text: exports an EDIFACT message in ASCII or database file. Description of how to export is in a receipt file. This file can be created with Mapper.exe. If an export is not successful the flag is set on.

docs.title: EDIEXPORT @a r [p]
docs.text: a EDIFACT file pointer number (0 or 1) r string, register or constant with receipt file name p path for exported data files, the item is not mandatory

docs.title: Example:
docs.text:
EDIREAD @0 "test.edi" 1

    EDIEXPORT @0 "ordersex.rcp"

    IF F THEN err

    END

    LABEL err

    EDIERROR @0 $7

    ERROR $7

docs.title: EDIFACT Functions
docs.text:
enable to work with EDI files, converts data, read and write in EDI messages.

EDIREAD reads an EDI file EDICOUNT counts the EDI messages in file EDIMESSAGE sets on a message in the file EDICREATE creates EDI file EDIERROR get last a error text EDIEXPORT exports from EDI message EDIIMPORT imports data to an EDI file EDIIMPEDI imports an EDI file to an EDI file EDICHECK checks message syntax and mandatory fields in EDI message EDIFATHER sets father of EDI field EDIGET reads item from a message EDISET sets one item in EDI message EDIMSGLEN returns number of bytes in messages EDIREADMSG read one message from file EDIUNA adds or removes UNA segment EDIUNB adds or removes UNB segment EDIUNBMSG sets on a specified UNB segment EDIWRITE writes in an EDI file EDIRESET resets all variables EDIGETSEG retrieves segment and level for a specified gegment in message EDIGETSEGS retrieves number of segments COUNTER reads counter number EAN check EAN

docs.title: EDIFATHER
docs.text: sets the father of segment. This instruction is important for instructions EDISET and EDIGET. If the segment is nested, the EDIFATHER instruction must be used to set fathers of needed segments. Flag is set on if error happens.

docs.title: EDIFATHER @a e
docs.text: a EDIFACT file pointer number (0 or 1) e EDIFACT navigation

docs.title: EDIGET
docs.text: gets one item from EDIFACT message and puts this value in variable. The flag is on set if error happens.

docs.title: EDIGET @a r e
docs.text: a EDIFACT file pointer number (0 or 1) r string, numeric or floating point variable e EDIFACT navigation

docs.title: EDIGETSEG
docs.text: gets a specified segment and level from the file opened by function EDIREAD. The flag is on set if error happens.

docs.title: EDIGETSEG @a b $c #d
docs.text: a EDIFACT file pointer number (0 or 1) b number or numeric register for segment number c string register number for retrieved segment d numeric register number for retrieved level

docs.title: EDIGETSEGS
docs.text: retrieves number of segments in file opened by function EDIREAD. The flag is on set if error happens.

docs.title: EDIGETSEGS @a #r
docs.text: a EDIFACT file pointer number (0 or 1) r numeric register number

docs.title: EDIIMPEDI
docs.text: imports data from one EDIFACT message to other EDIFACT message. Description how to import data is in receipt file. This file can be created with program edircpt.exe. The flag is set on if error happens.

docs.title: EDIIMPEDI @a @b r
docs.text: a destination EDIFACT file pointer number (0 or 1) b source EDIFACT file pointer number (0 or 1) r string, string variable or constant with receipt file name

docs.title: EDIIMPORT
docs.text: creates an EDIFACT message from any text or database file. Description of how to convert is in a receipt file. This file can be created with the program mapper.exe. The flag is set on if error happens.

docs.title: EDIIMPORT @a r [p]
docs.text: a EDIFACT file pointer number (0 or 1) r string, string variable or constant with receipt file name p path with data files, the item is not mandatory

docs.title: Example:
docs.text:
EDIIMPORT @0 "ordersim.rcp"

    IF !F THEN Write

    EDIERROR @0 $7

    ERROR $7

    LABEL Write

    EDIWRITE @0 "test.edi" 4

    IF !F THEN End

    ERROR "Cannot write in test.edi"

    LABEL End

    ...

docs.title: EDIMESSAGE
docs.text: sets the pointer to the message, which has the number in a numeric register. The flag is set on if an error happens.

docs.title: EDIMESSAGE @a b
docs.text: a EDIFACT file pointer number (0 or 1) b numeric register or number, (0, 1, 2, ...)

docs.title: EDIMSGLEN
docs.text: returns number of characters of in selected message. The flag is set on if an error happens.

docs.title: EDIMSGLEN @a #x
docs.text: a EDIFACT file pointer number (0 or 1) x number variable

docs.title: Example:
docs.text:
EDIREAD @0 "test.edi" 100 150

    IF !F THEN Label1

    EDIMSGLEN @0 #0

    EDIERROR @0 $1

    ERROR $1

docs.title: EDIREAD
docs.text: loads an EDIFACT file in memory and sets a pointer to the first message in file. The flag is set on if an error happens.

docs.title: EDIREAD @a n r
docs.text: a EDIFACT file pointer number (0 or 1) n string, string variable or constant with file name to read r 0 = full access; bit 1(1) = read only; bit 2(2) = do not go on first message; bit 3(4) = do not change date and time in UNB segment bit 4(8) = read message without EMF file, works for 0 level only

docs.title: Example:
docs.text:
EDIREAD @0 "test.edi" 0

    IF !F THEN Label1

    EDIERROR @0 $1

    ERROR $1

    END

    LABEL Label1

    ...

docs.title: EDIREADMSG
docs.text: loads an EDIFACT file in memory and sets a pointer to the first message in file. The flag is set on if an error happens.

docs.title: EDIREADMSG @a f p l
docs.text: a EDIFACT file pointer number (0 or 1) f string, string variable or constant with file name to read p position in file n number of characters to read

docs.title: EDIRESET
docs.text: resets all variables and memories linked with EDIFACT file pointer (@). The flag is set to FALSE. All right reserved

docs.title: EDISET
docs.text: saves one item in EDIFACT message. This value is in variable. The flag is set on if an error happens.

docs.title: EDISET @a r e
docs.text: a EDIFACT file pointer number (0 or 1) r string, numeric or floating point variable e EDIFACT navigation

docs.title: EDISIGN
docs.text: adds signature in an EDIFACT message. The flag is set on if an error happens. The private key for the signature must be instaled in Window system. There are 2 versions of syntax. Long version is for default signature. Short version is for more possibilities to set signature. If "USH,1,1" is set to 1, then Spar signature is required. If "USH,5,1" is set to 2, AUTACK is required. It is also possible to set hash algorithm in item "USA,1,4,,1": 6 is MD5; 16 is SHA1; 48 is SHA2. If item "USA,1,1,,1" is set, program assume all items has been set and does not set any default items.

docs.title: EDISIGN @e key $n [h a]
docs.text: e EDIFACT file pointer number (0 or 1) key string or string variable with serial number of private key (hexadecimal number without spaces) n number of string variable for hash created by this function h optional, hash algorithm: MD5, SHA1, SHA2 a optional, request of AUTACK message: 1 - AUTACK not requested 2 - AUTACK requested

docs.title: Example:
docs.text:
EDIREAD @0 "test.edi" 0

    EDISIGN @0 "012b6a" $L "SHA2" 2

    IF !F THEN Save

    EDIERROR @0 $0

    END

    LABEL Save

    EDIWRITE @0 "testSigned.edi" 0

    END

    ...

    EDIREAD @0 "test.edi" 0

    EDISET @0 "2" "USH,5,1" ; AUTACK requested

    EDISET @0 "48" "USA,1,1,,1" ; SHA2

    EDISIGN @0 "012b6a" $L

    IF !F THEN Save

    EDIERROR @0 $0

    END

    LABEL Save

    EDIWRITE @0 "testSigned.edi" 0

    END

    ...

    EDIREAD @0 "test.edi" 0

    EDISET @0 "1" "USH,1,1" ; required Spar signature

    EDISIGN @0 "012b6a" $L

    IF !F THEN Save

    EDIERROR @0 $0

    END

    LABEL Save

    EDIWRITE @0 "testSigned.edi" 0

    END

docs.title: EDISIGNEX
docs.text: adds signature in an EDIFACT message. The flag is set on if an error happens. The private key for the signature must be in pfx file. There are 2 versions of syntax. Long version is for default signature. Short version is for more possibilities to set signature. If "USH,1,1" is set to 1, then Spar signature is required. If "USH,5,1" is set to 2, AUTACK is required. It is also possible to set hash algorithm in item "USA,1,4,,1": 6 is MD5; 16 is SHA1; 48 is SHA2. If item "USA,1,1,,1" is set, program assume all items has been set and program does not set any default items.

docs.title: EDISIGNEX @e pfx pw $n [h a]
docs.text: e EDIFACT file pointer number (0 or 1) pfx string or string variable with file with certificate (*.pfx) pw string or string variable with password for private key n number of string variable for hash created by this function h optional, hash algorithm: MD5, SHA1, SHA2 a optional, request of AUTACK message: 1 - AUTACK not requested 2 - AUTACK requested

docs.title: Example:
docs.text:
EDIREAD @0 "test.edi" 0

    EDISIGNEX @0 "my.pfx" "password" $L "SHA2" 2

    IF !F THEN Save

    EDIERROR @0 $0

    END

    LABEL Save

    EDIWRITE @0 "testSigned.edi" 0

    END

    ...

    EDIREAD @0 "test.edi" 0

    EDISET @0 "2" "USH,5,1" ; AUTACK requested

    EDISET @0 "48" "USA,1,1,,1" ; SHA2

    EDISIGNEX @0 "my.pfx" "password" $L

    IF !F THEN Save

    EDIERROR @0 $0

    END

    LABEL Save

    EDIWRITE @0 "testSigned.edi" 0

    END

    ...

    EDIREAD @0 "test.edi" 0

    EDISET @0 "1" "USH,1,1" ; required Spar signature

    EDISIGNEX @0 "my.pfx" "password" $L

    IF !F THEN Save

    EDIERROR @0 $0

    END

    LABEL Save

    EDIWRITE @0 "testSigned.edi" 0

    END

docs.title: EDI Script
docs.text:
EDI script is a simple language for EDIFACT functions and a lot of other common thinks. See folowing topics:

  • Introduction
  • Variables
  • EDI navigation
  • Keywords in alfabetic order
  • Basic functions
  • Logical functions
  • String functions
  • EDIFACT functions
  • Sign and cipher functions
  • ANSI X12 functions
  • Mail message
  • Table functions
  • File functions
  • Window functions
  • Run external code functions
  • Excel functions
  • XML functions
  • SQL functions
  • Print functions

docs.title: EDIUNA
docs.text: adds or removes UNA segment. The function adds UNA segment before first message. Communication envelope UNB-UNZ must exist . The flag is set on if an error happens.

docs.title: EDIUNA @a x
docs.text: a EDIFACT file pointer number (0 or 1) x 0 for segment to remove; 1 for segment to add

docs.title: Example:
docs.text:
EDIREAD @0 "test.edi" 0

    IF F THEN Error

    EDIUNA @0 1 ; add UNB segment

    IF F THEN Error

    EDIWRITE @0 "test.edi" 1

    IF F THEN Error

    END

    LABEL Error

    EDIERROR @0 $0

    BOX $0 "EDI" 1

    END

docs.title: EDIUNB
docs.text: adds or removes UNB and UNZ segment. The function creates communication envelope. The function adds UNB segment before first message and UNZ segment after last message. The flag is set on if an error happens.

docs.title: EDIUNB @a x
docs.text: a EDIFACT file pointer number (0 or 1) x 0 for segment to remove; 1 for segment to add

docs.title: Example:
docs.text:
EDIREAD @0 "test.edi" 0

    IF F THEN Error

    EDIUNB @0 1 ; add UNB segment

    IF F THEN Error

    EDIWRITE @0 "test.edi" 1

    IF F THEN Error

    END

    LABEL Error

    EDIERROR @0 $0

    BOX $0 "EDI" 1

    END

docs.title: EDIUNBMSG
docs.text: sets the pointer to the message with a specified UNB segment. The number of UNB segment is in a numeric register. The flag is set on if an error happens.

docs.title: EDIUNBMSG @a b
docs.text: a EDIFACT file pointer number (0 or 1) b numeric register or number, (0, 1, 2, ...)

docs.title: Example:
docs.text:
EDIREAD @0 "test.edi" 0

    IF F THEN Error

    LET #0=0

    LABEL Loop

    EDIUNBMSG @0 1 ; add UNB segment

    IF F THEN End

    EDIWRITE @0 "x.edi" 132

    IF F THEN Error

    LET #0=#0+1

    GOTO Loop

    LABEL Error

    EDIERROR @0 $0

    BOX $0 "EDI" 1

    LABEL End

    END

docs.title: EDIVERIF
docs.text: verifies a signature in the EDIFACT message. The flag is set on if an error happens. The public key for the signature used in message must be instaled in Window system.

docs.title: EDIVERIF @a $n
docs.text: a EDIFACT file pointer number (0 or 1) n number of string variable for hash from the signature

docs.title: Example:
docs.text:
EDIREAD @0 "test.edi" 0

    EDIVERIF @0 $L

    IF !F THEN Ok

    EDIERROR @0 $0

    ...

    LABEL Ok

    ...

docs.title: EDIVERIFEX
docs.text: verifies a signature in the EDIFACT message. The flag is set on if an error happens. File name of the public key for the signature must be defined. If file name is empty default certifikate name is used: \Certif(UNB,2,1)_(USC,1,1).cer (sender_serNum.cer).

docs.title: EDIVERIFEX @a f $n
docs.text: a EDIFACT file pointer number (0 or 1) f file name for public key, if string is empty default file name is used. n number of string variable for hash from the signature

docs.title: Example:
docs.text:
EDIREAD @0 "test.edi" 0

    EDIVERIFEX @0 "C:\Certif\test.cer" $L

    IF !F THEN Ok

    EDIERROR @0 $0

    ...

    LABEL Ok

    ...

docs.title: EDIWRITE
docs.text: saves EDIFACT message(s) in file. The flag is set on if an error happens.

docs.title: EDIWRITE @a f x
docs.text: a EDIFACT file pointer number (0 or 1) f file name x bit parameters: bit 0 (1) - 1 = overwrite; 0 = do not overwrite, error happens if file exist bit 1 (2) - 1 = one message only; 0 = all messages; bit 2 (4) - 1 = append bit 3 (8) - 1 = save according setting (next bits); 0 = save message as it is bit 4 (16) - 1 = save UNA segment if exist; 0 save without UNA segment bit 5 (32) - 1 = save UNB segment if exist; 0 save without UNB segment bit 6 (64) - 1 = save UNG segment if exist; 0 save without UNG segment bit 7 (128) - 1 = save segments from selected UNB to UHT

docs.title: Example:
docs.text:
EDIWRITE @0 "test.edi" 4 ; append all messages

    ...

    EDIWRITE @0 "test0.edi" 6 ; append one message only

docs.title: ELLIPSE
docs.text: prints ellipse. A PEN can change margin and a BRUSH can change inside of ellipse.

docs.title: ELLIPSE l t r b
docs.text: l left coordinate for ellipse t top coordinate for ellipse r right coordinate for ellipse b bottom coordinate for ellipse

docs.title: END
docs.text: terminates an action. The action starts with a keyword ACTION and must be terminated with an END or ERROR.

docs.title: Example:
docs.text:
ACTION 1 ; My action

    ...

    IF F THEN error

    ...

    END

    LABEL error

    ...

    ERROR "Error in my action"

docs.title: ERROR
docs.text: terminates an action with an error message. Every action must start with a keyword ACTION and terminates with the keyword END or ERROR.

docs.title: ERROR a
docs.text: a string or string register; action is terminated with this message, usually it is displayed in an error dialog window or it is written in a log file

docs.title: Example:
docs.text:
ACTION 1 ; My action

    ...

    IF F THEN error

    ...

    END

    LABEL error

    ...

    ERROR "Error in my action"

docs.title: EXCELCLOSE
docs.text: closes an opened excel file (.xls). The excel file can be opend by EXCELOPEN function.

docs.title: EXCELGET
docs.text: reads value from specified cell. The excel file must be opened by function EXCELOPEN.

docs.title: EXCELGET s v
docs.text:
s string with cell description v string register for value to put from a cell

or

docs.title: EXCELGET r c v
docs.text: r number of row c number of column v string register for value to put from a cell

docs.title: EXCELOPEN
docs.text:
opens an excel file (.xls) for reading and writing. The excel file must be closed by function EXCELCLOSE.

    NOTE: If the function does not work in service try to create directory for Windows x64:

    C:\Windows\SysWOW64\config\systemprofile\Desktop

    or for Windows x86:

    C:\Windows\System32\config\systemprofile\Desktop

docs.title: EXCELSET
docs.text: sets value in specified cell. The excel file must be opened by function EXCELOPEN. Format: c v r c v Example: See also: All right reserved

docs.title: EXCELSET s v
docs.text:
s string with cell description v string for value to put in a cell

or

docs.title: EXCELSET r c v
docs.text: r number of row c number of column v string for value to put in a cell

docs.title: EXCELSHEET
docs.text: selects an excel sheet. The excel file must be opened by function EXCELOPEN.

docs.title: Excel Functions
docs.text:
work with .xls and .xlsx files. EXCELOPEN must be first function. Use long file name. Use EXCELCLOSE in the end of work. Do not forget to save your changes with EXCELSAVE.

EXCELOPEN opens an excel file EXCELGET gets value from excel cell EXCELSET puts a value in an excel cell EXCELSHEET selects excel sheet EXCELSAVE saves data in excel file EXCELCLOSE closes an opened excel file

docs.title: FILECLOSE
docs.text: closes the file opened by function FILEOPEN.

docs.title: FILECOPY
docs.text: copies a file. The flag is set on if an error happens.

docs.title: FILECOPY s d f
docs.text: s string, string variable or constant for source file name d string, string variable or constant for destination file name f flag, bit combination bit 0 (1) = overwrite bit 1 (2) = delete source bit 2 (4) = append

docs.title: FILEDELETE
docs.text: deletes the file. The flag is set on if an error happens.

docs.title: FILEEXIST
docs.text: sets the flag on if the file does not exist.

docs.title: Example:
docs.text:
CONST Test "test.edi"

    FILEEXIST Test

    IF F THEN err

    EDIREAD @0 Test 1

    ...

    LABEL err

    ...CONST Test "test.edi"

    FILEEXIST Test

    IF F THEN err

    EDIREAD @0 Test 1

    ...

    LABEL err

    ...

docs.title: FILEEXT
docs.text: changes file name extension to new specified extension.

docs.title: FILEEXT f e
docs.text: f string register for file name e string with a new extention

docs.title: FILELENGTH f l
docs.text: f file name l numeric register for file length

docs.title: FILENAME
docs.text: separates a short file name from a full path name.

docs.title: FILENAME r $a
docs.text: r full path file name a string variable for short file name

docs.title: FILEOPEN
docs.text: opens text file for reading with function READTEXT or READSEG. The flag is set if error happens.

docs.title: FILETIME
docs.text: gets time of file and puts it in numeric variable. Flag is set if error happen.

docs.title: FILETIME a #b
docs.text: a path of unique file name b numeric variable number for file time

docs.title: FILEUNIQUE
docs.text: creates a unique file name in a selected directory. The file name is created from actual date: YYMMDDHHMM.edi.

docs.title: FILEUNIQUE a $b e
docs.text: a path for unique name (a first part of a file name) b string register for unique file name e string with extension

docs.title: FINDFILE
docs.text: find file in specified path. The path is specified by FINDPATH. The function set a flag if file not found.

docs.title: Example:
docs.text:
FINDPATH "c:\test*.edi"

    LABEL FindFile

    FINDFILE $0

    IF F THEN End

    ;

    GOTO FindFile

    LABEL End

docs.title: FINDPATH
docs.text: set a path for finding files in specified path. A fuction FINDFILE returns then file name.

docs.title: Example:
docs.text:
FINDPATH "c:\test*.edi"

    LABEL FindFile

    FINDFILE $0

    IF F THEN End

    ;

    GOTO FindFile

    LABEL End

docs.title: FONT
docs.text: prepare font for function TEXT. First two parameters are mandatory.

docs.title: FONT "Name",Height,Width,Weight,Type,Escapement
docs.text: Name name of font Height height of font Width width of font, default is 0 Weight weight of font in ranch 0-9 Type type: 0 - normal; 1 - italic; 2 - underline; 3 - strikeout

docs.title: File Functions
docs.text:
enable to work with files.

PROGPATH path of program INIREAD reads from an .INI file INIWRITE write in .INI file FINDPATH set path for finding files FINDFILE find file in specified path FILECOPY copies a file FILEEXIST test if file exist RENAME renames a file FILEEXT changes file name extension FILELENGTH retrieves length of file FILENAME gets a file name from the path file name FILEDELETE deletes a file FILEOPEN opens file for reading READLINE read one line form file READSEG read one segment from file READTEXT read specified number of characters from file FILECLOSE closes file FILETIME gets a file time FILEUNIQUE creates an unique file name GUID creates an unique file name WRITE writes a text in a file WRITEN writes a text in a file with a new line in the end CONVFILE converts file according code table

docs.title: GETFIELD
docs.text: reads one item form segment read by function READSEG.

docs.title: GETFIELD s d ele sub
docs.text: s source string register d destination string register ele element sub subelement

docs.title: GETITEM
docs.text: reads one item from line from file opened by function FILEOPEN separated by any separator.

docs.title: GETITEM s d col sep
docs.text: s source string register d destination string register col column to read sep one character for separator

docs.title: GETTEXT s d pos len
docs.text: s source string register d destination string register pos position to start to read (1, 2, 3, ...) len number of characters to read

docs.title: GOTO
docs.text: jumps on line with a keyword LABEL which has the same parameter as GOTO.

docs.title: GUID
docs.text: creates GUID, unique string for file name.

docs.title: IF
docs.text: is the basic test. The program continues according to the result of the test. If the result of the test is TRUE, the program continues on line with the same label which is after THEN. If the result of the test is FALSE the program continues on the next line.

docs.title: IF e THEN a
docs.text: e equation with =, !=, <, >, <=, >=, F (flag) or !F (not flag) a name of label to jump if result of equation is true

docs.title: Example:
docs.text:
LET #1=1

    LET #2=5

    IF #1>#2 THEN a1

    LET $0="test" IF $1!=$0 THEN a1

    ...

    IF !F THEN a1

    ...

    LABEL a1

    ...

docs.title: IFEMPTY
docs.text: tests, if string variable is empty. If string variable is empty the program jumps to a LABEL which has the same name like the name after THEN. If the string variable is not empty the program continues on the next line.

docs.title: IFEMPTY $a THEN b
docs.text: a string variable number (0..9,L) b name of label to jump if string variable is empty

docs.title: IFFULL
docs.text: tests, if the string variable is not empty. If the string variable is not empty the program jumps to the LABEL which has the same name like the name after THEN. If the string variable is empty the program continues on the next line.

docs.title: IFFULL $a THEN b
docs.text: a string variable number (0..9,L) b name of label to jump if string variable is not empty

docs.title: INBOX
docs.text: shows a dialog box for input. The script stops and wait for a user action. The user can set a title, a text and a default value in this window. If the user press OK button, the function returns the text written by the user. If the user cancel the window flag is set. Do not use this function in server mode!

docs.title: INBOX text title default register
docs.text: text string variable or constant with text of inbox title string variable or constant with title of inbox window default string variable or constant with default text in edit window register register for returning value

docs.title: INIREAD f s e r
docs.text: f file name s section e entry a register

docs.title: INIWRITE f s e a
docs.text: f file name s section e entry a value to write

docs.title: EDI Script Introduction
docs.text:
Script files are possible to create with program "EdiScrpt.exe". Default extension for script file is .pcs. Compilation creates two files: .pcf is code file used in programs and .deb file with debug information for tracing instructions.

Every line of the script file must start with a keyword which must be written in capital letters and must start on first position in line. The following comment - if there is one - must start with this character ";". The program always starts with a keyword "ACTION x" and terminates with keywords END or ERROR.

    In a single script file can be more then one keyword ACTION. It is recommended to
    use the comment after keyword ACTION. The following comment must be on the same
    line. Example:

    ACTION 1 ; Import

    This comment is important for some programs. The programs show the user this text
    in a selection box. EDIFACT script use string, numeric, floating point variables,
    EDIFACT pointers and flag. These variables are available during the action, but
    their values are not available for the next execution. Usually all variables are
    0 and strings are empty. In some programs some values are set before the start of
    the first keyword. See also other helps.

docs.title: Keywords
docs.text: ; comment ~TO$ converts a floating point variable to a string ACTION the first instruction of process BARCODE prints barcode BEEP beep BITMAP prints bitmap BOX shows window for messages BOXYESNO shows window with Yes and No button BRUSH changes brush CALL calls procedure CASE case of switch CONST text constant CONVFILE converts file according code table CONVTEXT converts text according code table COUNTER reads counter number EAN check EAN EDIAUTACK creates AUTACK message EDICHECK checks message syntax and mandatory fields in EDI message EDICIPHER ciphers EDIFACT message to message CIPHER EDICOUNT counts the EDI messages in file EDICREATE creates EDI file EDIDECIPHER deciphers message CIPHER EDIERROR get last a error text EDIEXPORT exports from EDI message EDIFATHER sets father of EDI field EDIGET reads item from a message EDIGETSEG retrieves segment and level for a specified gegment in message EDIGETSEGS retrieves number of segments EDIIMPEDI imports an EDI file to an EDI file EDIIMPORT imports data to an EDI file EDIMESSAGE sets on a message in the file EDIMSGLEN returns number of bytes in messages EDIREAD reads an EDI file EDIREADMSG read one message from file EDIRESET resets all variables EDISET sets one item in EDI message EDISIGN signes EDI message EDIUNA adds or removes UNA segment EDIUNB adds or removes UNB segment EDIUNBMSG sets on a specified UNB segment EDIVERIF verifies signed message EDIWRITE writes in an EDI file ELLIPSE prints ellipse END end of action ERROR end of action with an error EXCELCLOSE closes an opened excel file EXCELGET gets value from excel cell EXCELOPEN opens an excel file EXCELSAVE saves data in excel file EXCELSET puts a value in an excel cell EXCELSHEET selects excel sheet FILECLOSE closes file FILECOPY copies a file FILEDELETE deletes a file FILEEXIST test if file exist FILEEXT changes file name extension FILELENGTH retrieves length of file FILENAME gets a file name from the path file name FILEOPEN opens file for reading FILETIME gets a file time FILEUNIQUE creates an unique file name FINDFILE find file in specified path FINDPATH set path for finding files FONT changes font GETFIELD get EDI field from string GETITEM get item from string GETTEXT get text from string GOTO goes to the line GUID goes to the line IF test IFEMPTY tests if a string is empty IFFULL tests if a string is full INBOX shows window for input INIREAD reads from an .INI file INIWRITE write in .INI file LABEL label for jump LET equation LINE prints a line MAIL send e-mail NEWACTION jump to other ACTION NUMBER jump to other ACTION OPENBOX shows window "Open File" ORIENTATION sets orientation of printing PAGE creates new page PEN changes pen PRINT prints all pages PRINTCLOSE closes print buffer PRINTOPEN opens print buffer PRINTPREVIEW shows "print preview" window PROC beginning of a procedure PROGPATH path of program READLINE read one line form file READSEG read one segment from file READTEXT read specified number of characters from file RECTANGLE prints rectangle REMOVESPACES renames a file RENAME renames a file RETURN returns from a procedure ROUNDRECT prints round rectangle RUN runs other executable file RUNEX runs program on externa PC RUNS runs other script file RUNX runs executable file and wait for the end of process SAVEBOX shows window "Save File" SETPRINTER sets default printer SQLCLOSE closes SQL connection SQLCONNECT starts SQL connection SQLERROR returns error string from SQL command SQLEXEC executes SQL command SQLFETCH reads one line from table after command SELECT SQLGET gets value from table after command SELECT SQLSELECT executes command SELECT SQLSET sets value for command SQLEXEC STRCOPY copies a string STRFIND copies a string STRLEN returns length of string STRTOTIME converts a string to a time STRUPPER converts string to upper case SWITCH switch for a different string values TABLEAPPEND appends a record in a table TABLECLOSE closes a table TABLECREATE creates a table TABLEDELETE deletes an actual record from table TABLEFIND searches in a table TABLENEXT repeatedly finds the next value TABLEOPEN opens a table TABLEOPENR opens a table for reading only TABLEOPENX opens a table without index TABLEOPENXR opens a table without index for reading only TABLEREAD reads a field from a table TABLERECORD goes to a record in a table TABLEUPDATE updates a record in a table TABLEWRITE writes a field in an actual record TEXT print text TEXTALIGN aligns text TEXTCOLOR changes color for text TEXTR print text in limited rectangle TIME gets actual time TIMETOSTR convert a time to a string TRIM trim string WAIT temporary end WRITE writes a text in a file WRITEN writes a text in a file with a new line in the end X12COUNT counts the X12 messages in file X12ERROR get last a error text X12EXPORT exports from X12 message X12FATHER sets father of X12 field X12GET reads item from a message X12CHECK checks message syntax and mandatory fields in X12 message X12IMPORT imports data to an X12 file X12MESSAGE sets on a message in the file X12READ reads an EDI file X12RESET resets all variables X12SET sets one item in X12 message X12WRITE writes in an X12 file XMLATTRGET retrieves an attribute from XML tag XMLATTRSET sets an attribute in a XML tag XMLCLOSE closes XML document XMLERROR retrieves error text after XMLOPEN XMLOPEN opens XML document XMLROOTTAG retrieves root tag of a XML document XMLSAVE saves XML document in a file XMLTAG searchs for specified tag in XML document XMLTAGSET creates new tag XMLTEXTGET retrieves text of specified tag of XML document XMLTEXTSET writes text in a tag

docs.title: LABEL
docs.text: is a place in the script where a program can jump to.

docs.title: LASTERROR
docs.text: copies the last error text in string variable.

docs.title: LET
docs.text: is a basic instruction for changing value of variables. A left site of equation must always be a variable, the right part can be a variable, constant, string or number split by an arithmetic sign. There must not be any spaces in the equation. There is an automatic conversion according to a variable in the left part of the equation. Absorber is character '?'.

docs.title: LET va=r
docs.text: v variable type ($, #, ~) a variable number r right part of equation with +, -, *, / between variables, constants, numbers and strings

docs.title: LINE
docs.text: draws line. The pen to use to draw can be specified with the PEN function. Default pen is black.

docs.title: LINE l t r b
docs.text: l left coordinate of line t top coordinate of line r right coordinate of line b bottom coordinate of line

docs.title: Logical Functions
docs.text:
enable to test values and split script according result.

IF test IFEMPTY tests if a string is empty IFFULL tests if a string is full SWITCH switch for a different string values CASE case of switch

docs.title: MAIL
docs.text: sends e-mail to a specified e-mail address. The flag is set if an error happened.

docs.title: MAIL "Server" "From" "To" "Subject" "Text" "File" "UserName" "Password"
docs.text: Server address of SMTP server From e-mail address of sender To e-mail address of receiver Subject Subject of message Text text of message File file name for attached file UserName user name, can be empty string Password password for user name, can be empty string

docs.title: MAILRECEIVE
docs.text: receives emails from a specified email address using protocol POP3. The flag is set if an error happened.

docs.title: MAILRECEIVE "Server" "UserName" "Password" "Original" "Text" "Attach"
docs.text: Server address of POP3 server UserName user name Password password for user name Original path for original messages, whole messages Text path for text separated from messages Attach path for files attached to messages

docs.title: Example:
docs.text:
MAILRECEIVE "pop3.server.com" "Test" "password" "Original" "Text" "Attach"

    IF F THEN error

    ...

    LABEL error

docs.title: NEWACTION
docs.text: jumps to other ACTION and script continues there.

docs.title: Example:
docs.text:
ACTION 1 ; My action

    ...

    NEWACTION 2
    ;this code will never be run

    END

    ACTION 2

    ; script continues here"

    END

docs.title: NUMBER
docs.text: correctes a number in a string register to valid number.

docs.title: EDIFACT Navigation
docs.text: is a string which describes how to find a value from the EDIFACT message or where to save the value in the EDIFACT message. Items in the string are separated by "," (comma). There must not be spaces between items or commas.

docs.title: Format:
docs.text:
"u,seg,e,s,t,l,r,fe1,fs1,fv1,fe2,fs2,fv2,fe3,fs3,fv3"

u segments group, conditional; 0 = default, search starts from first segment; 1 = search start after segment UNS+D'; 2 = search starts after segment UNS+S' seg segment tag, segment has 3 capital letters or character = switch means that segment is the same like in previous function EDIGET, EDISET or EDIFATHER e element number, means how many + are in front of item s sub element number, means how many : are in front of item plus 1, + resets value to 1 t short file name of table for conversion, conditional, default value is empty, value is searched in first column of dbf table and if value is found value from second column is retrieved, slash (/) with number after table name means a column of the table l level, conditional, default = 0, level means level of nested segments (0,1, 2, ...) r repeat, conditional, default = 0, repeat means repeat of segment (0, 1, 2, ...), -1 is next repeat fe1, fe2, fe3 filter element, conditional if not used, similar to e fs1, fs2, fs3 filter sub element, conditional if not used, similar to s fv1, fv2, fv3 filter value, conditional if not used

docs.title: OPENBOX
docs.text: shows an "Open File" dialog box for selecting a file name. A flag is set on if user press button "Close".

docs.title: OPENBOX $a $b
docs.text: a string register for the file name b string or string register with label of box, if string is empty default label is used

docs.title: Example:
docs.text:
OPENBOX $0 ""

    IF !F THEN Open

    END

    LABEL Open

    ...

docs.title: ORIENTATION
docs.text: sets orientation of printing: portrait or landscape.

docs.title: PEN
docs.text: prepares pen for functions LINE, RECTANGLE and ROUNDRECT. Default pen is black.

docs.title: PEN style,width,r,g,b
docs.text: style 0 - creates a solid pen. 1 - creates a dashed pen. (Valid only when the pen width is 1.) 2 - creates a dotted pen. (Valid only when the pen width is 1.) 3 - creates a pen with alternating dashes and dots. (Valid only when the pen width is 1.) 4 - creates a pen with alternating dashes and double dots. (Valid only when the pen width is 1.) 5 - creates a null pen. 6 - creates a pen that draws a line inside the frame of closed shapes produced by graphics device interface (GDI) output functions that specify a bounding rectangle (for example, the RECTANGLE, ROUNDRECT functions). When this style is used with GDI output functions that do not specify a bounding rectangle, the drawing area of the pen is not limited by a frame. width specifies the pen width, in logical units. If the width member is zero, the pen is one pixel r,g,b red, green, blue colors of line in range 0-255

docs.title: Example:
docs.text:
PRINTOPEN

    PEN 1 1 255 0 0 ; dashed red pen

    LINE 10 10 100 10"

    PRINTPREVIEW

    PRINTCLOSE

docs.title: PRINTCLOSE
docs.text: closes print buffer and free memory used for printing.

docs.title: PRINTOPEN
docs.text: opens print buffer. The buffer is need for printing. All print must start with this instruction and terminate with instruction PRINTCLOSE.

docs.title: PRINTPREVIEW
docs.text: opens "Print Preview" window and shows prepared print. From the window is possible to see all pages, zoom pages or print.

docs.title: PROC
docs.text: is a starting keyword for a procedure. The procedure is a part of a program which can be used more then once in different parts of source file and in different actions. The procedure must terminate with a keyword RETURN. It is not possible to call other procedures inside that procedure.

docs.title: PROGPATH
docs.text: copies a full directory of the program to a string variable.

docs.title: Print Functions
docs.text:
An user can prepare his print (WYSIWYG). The print must start with a PRINTOPEN, then follows items to print, in the end is function PRINT or PRINTPREVIEW and the print always terminates with a PRINTCLOSE.

BARCODE prints barcode BITMAP prints bitmap BRUSH changes brush ELLIPSE prints ellipse FONT changes font LINE prints a line ORIENTATION sets orientation of printing PAGE creates new page PEN changes pen PRINT prints all pages PRINTCLOSE closes print buffer PRINTOPEN opens print buffer PRINTPREVIEW shows "print preview" window RECTANGLE prints rectangle ROUNDRECT prints round rectangle SETPRINTER sets default printer TEXT print text TEXTALIGN aligns text TEXTCOLOR changes color for text TEXTR print text in limited rectangle

docs.title: READLINE
docs.text: read one line from file opened by function FILEOPEN.

docs.title: READSEG
docs.text: reads one EDI segment from the file opened by function FILEOPEN.

docs.title: READTEXT
docs.text: reads specified number of characters from file opened by function FILEOPEN.

docs.title: READTEXT r n
docs.text: r string register n number of chracters to read

docs.title: RECTANGLE
docs.text: draws rectangle. The style of the line to use is specified with the PEN instruction, color to use as background of the rectangle can be specified by using the BRUSH keyword.

docs.title: RECTANGLE l t r b
docs.text: l left coordinate of rectangle t top coordinate of rectangle r right coordinate of rectangle b bottom coordinate of rectangle

docs.title: Example:
docs.text:
PRINTOPEN

    BRUSH 127 127 127 ; gray brush

    RECTANGLE 10 10 200 100

    PRINTPREVIEW

    PRINTCLOSE

docs.title: REMOVESPACES $a x
docs.text: a number of string register with text x 0 = removes all spaces; 1 = leave maximum one space

docs.title: RENAME a b
docs.text: a old file name b new file name

docs.title: RETURN
docs.text: is a keyword which terminates the procedure. The procedure is a part of the program which can be used more then once in different parts of source file and in different actions.

docs.title: ROUNDRECT
docs.text: draws rounded rectangle. The style of the line to use is specified with the PEN instruction, color to use as background of the rectangle can be specified by using the BRUSH keyword.

docs.title: ROUNDRECT l t r b w h
docs.text: l left coordinate of rectangle t top coordinate of rectangle b bottom coordinate of rectangle l left coordinate of rectangle w width of ellipse used to draw rounded corners h height of ellipse used to draw rounded corners

docs.title: Example:
docs.text:
PRINTOPEN

    BRUSH 127 127 127 ; gray brush

    ROUNDRECT 10 10 200 100 10 10

    PRINTPREVIEW

    PRINTCLOSE

docs.title: RUN
docs.text: is an instruction for running a program. The flag is set on if an instruction is not successful.

docs.title: RUNEX
docs.text:
is an instruction for running a program on an externel PC. The script can wait till the program is finished. The flag is set on if an instruction is not successful. The instruction is based on distributed COM technologi. A user have to register EDICOM RunEx component using command line:

RunEx /Regserver

    The user can check if component is registered succesfuly by using program dcomcnfg.exe.
    If DCOM is not instaled on a PC run dcom98.exe and dcm98cfg.exe. Settings for DCOM
    (dcomcnfg.exe) should be:

    Autentication Level = None

    Default Impersonation Level = Identify

    If the instruction works only once (usualy in Windows 95) then run program EdiLoader.exe.
    The program will keep komponent in memory till you stop the program. The instruction
    has no problem to use this component then.

    The component is possible to unregister using command line:

RunEx /Unregserver

docs.title: RUNEX exe pc x
docs.text: exe command line pc name of PC where to run program x 0 = not wait for end of program; 1 = wait for end of program

docs.title: RUNS
docs.text: runs other script file. EDIFACT, numeric, floating point and string registers are copied to new script according a parameter p. A flag is set if error happened.

docs.title: RUNS "scrip.pcf" a p
docs.text: script.pcf script file name with extension .pcf a action number p parameter: bit 0 (1) - copy EDIFACT pointer to new script bit 1 (2) - copy all/no registers to new script bit 2 (4) - copy registers $0, #0; if bit 1 is set, registers $1 and #1 are also copied

docs.title: RUNX
docs.text: is an instruction for running a program. The script waits till the program is finished. The flag is set on if an instruction is not successful.

docs.title: Run Functions
docs.text:
enable to run other EDI scripts or programs.

RUN runs other executable file RUNEX runs program on externa PC RUNS runs other script file RUNX runs executable file and wait for the end of process

docs.title: SAVEBOX
docs.text: shows an "Save File" dialog box for selecting or creating file name. A flag is set on if user press button "Close".

docs.title: SAVEBOX $a $b
docs.text: a string register for the file name b string or string register with label of box, if string is empty default label is used

docs.title: Example:
docs.text:
SAVEBOX $0 ""

    IF !F THEN Save

    END

    LABEL Save

    ...

docs.title: SETPRINTER
docs.text: sets printer as a default printer for printing by using script function PRINT.

docs.title: SQL Functions
docs.text:
enable to work with database tables using ODBC. User can work with SQL Server. User can prepare ODBC connection to his database an then use SQL functions to exchange data. SQLCONNECT must be first function. Connection is closed with SQLCLOSE.

SQLCONNECT starts SQL connection SQLEXEC executes SQL command SQLSELECT executes command SELECT SQLFETCH reads one line from table after command SELECT SQLGET gets value from table after command SELECT SQLSET sets value for command SQLEXEC SQLERROR returns error string from SQL command SQLCLOSE closes SQL connection

docs.title: SQLCLOSE
docs.text: closes the SQL connection opened by function SQLCONNECT.

docs.title: Example:
docs.text:
SQLCONNECT "DSN=EDI"

    IF !F THEN Exec

    END

    LABEL Exec

    ...

    SQLCLOSE

docs.title: SQLCONNECT
docs.text: opens an SQL connection. The SQL connection must be closed by function SQLCLOSE.

docs.title: SQLCONNECT s
docs.text:
s string for connection string

The connection string uses the following keywords:

DSN The name of the data source as it is returned by SQLDataSources. The DSN keyword is not used if the DRIVER keyword is used. DRIVER The name of the driver as returned by SQLDrivers. The DRIVER keyword is not used if the DSN keyword is used. The SQL Server driver name is {SQL Server}. (For a 16-bit program, the 32-bit driver name is {SQL Server (32 bit)}.) SERVER The name of the server on the network on which the data source resides. When running on Microsoft Windows NT, "(local)" can be entered as the server, in which case, a local copy of SQL Server can be used, even when this is a non-networked version. Note that when the 16-bit SQL Server driver is using "(local)" without a network, the "MS Loopback Adapter" must be installed. UID The user login ID. PWD The user-specified password. APP The name of the application calling SQLDriverConnect (optional). WSID The workstation ID. Typically, this is the network name of the computer on which the application resides (optional). DATABASE The name of the SQL Server database (optional). LANGUAGE The national language to be used by SQL Server (optional).
